subject: Relationships
title: Why Your Brain Falls in Love
description: A fast breakdown of Why Your Brain Falls in Love for builders.

hook.text: You lock eyes across a crowded room and your heart races. That's not romance â€” it's neurochemistry.

buildup.text: Dopamine surges when you see someone attractive, creating the same high as a hit of cocaine.

discovery.text: Norepinephrine makes your palms sweat and your stomach flip. Your body thinks you're in danger.

twist.text: The brain can't tell the difference between fear and excitement. Roller coasters and first dates feel alike.

climax.text: Love isn't a choice your heart makes. It's a chemical cocktail your brain mixes without asking permission.

punchline.text: Falling in love is a chemical reaction, not a decision.

quiz.question: Which neurotransmitter surges when you see someone attractive?
